bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert G. Love, November 19, 1951

div1.p: Hench informs Love that he will not be able to attend the Walter Reed Memorial Association meeting. He writes that he is going to make one more effort [to memorialize Camp Lazear] when he returns to Cuba in several months.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert G. Love, November 19, 1951
div1.opener:
November 19, 1951
General Albert G. Love
2709 Wisconsin Avenue N.W.
Washington, D.C.
My dear General Love:
div1.p:
Two or three weeks ago I wrote and telephoned Colonel Siler about the
forthcoming meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. I had
hoped that it might perhaps be held about two weeks ago when I was down
east, as I told Colonel Siler that I could not come later. He assured
me that there would be no special business that would require my
presence and that he did not believe that it was possible to call the
meeting to coincide with my eastern trip. I regret therefore that I
will not be able to attend.

I would like to have you read the enclosures, copies of which I am sending
to Colonel Siler. I shall let you know what, if anything, I hear from Mr.
Rath and if any of the members of the Walter Reed Memorial Association
can give me any advice, I shall be glad to have it. I am going to make
one more effort and am going to Cuba in January. I have had some cor-
respondence with Madam Rojas and will write to others in Cuba in the
next few weeks. I do hope that the help from this source (The National
Trust for Historic Preservation) will assist me in accomplishing
something.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
